2015, Milledgeville, Baldwin Co., GA, Obituary

Published in The Fairfax County Times (Reston, VA) from May 22 to June 19, 2015

Mrs. Ida Belle Blankenship Monroe, age 92 [1923], passed away on Tuesday, May 19, 2015.

Funeral services will be conducted on Friday, May 29, 2015 at 1 PM in the Chapel of Williams Funeral Home in Milledgeville, with interment at the Georgia Veterans Memorial Cemetery at 2:30 PM.

Ida was an avid golfer, bowler and bridge player. She is survived by her husband of 72 years, Leo L. Monroe; son, Scott (Cheryl) Monroe of Milledgeville; daughter, Elizabeth (Cliff) Reynolds of Fairfax, VA; grandchildren, Ashley Nam of Fairfax, Rachel Koch of Washington DC, Chelsea and Doug Monroe, both of Milledgeville; great-grandchildren, Chase Nam, Sam Koch, and Alexandra McDade.

From: Diane Renfrow dhrenfrow(at)yahoo.com

2015, Milledgeville, Baldwin Co., GA, Obituary

The Union-Recorder, (Milledgeville, GA) - September 25, 2015

Mr. Leo LeRoy Monroe, age 94, passed away on Tuesday, September 22, 2015.

Funeral services will be held at 3 PM on Tuesday, September 29, 2015 in the Chapel of Williams Funeral Home of Milledgeville. Private Interment will be held at Georgia Veterans Memorial Cemetery.

Mr. Monroe was a native of Sioux Falls, South Dakota and lived in Phoenix, Arizona prior to moving to Milledgeville 6 years ago to be near his son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren.

He was preceded in death by his wife of over 72 years, Ida Blankenship Monroe and his parents, William H. Monroe and Elizabeth May Monroe.

He was a 32nd Degree Mason and a retired Naval Officer having served in the Pacific during WWII, and Korea. Mr. Monroe retired from the Navy after 22 years. He then worked for New York University in New York City and later retired from a retail pharmaceutical chain in northern Virginia before moving to Arizona.

He is survived by his son, Scott (Cheryl) Monroe of Milledgeville; daughter, Elizabeth (Cliff) Reynolds of Fairfax, VA; Grandchildren, Ashley Nam, of Fairfax, VA, Rachel Koch, of Washington, DC, Chelsea Monroe and Doug Monroe, both of Milledgeville; and great-grandchildren, Sam Koch, Chase Nam and Alexandra McDade.

+2019, Adairsville, Bartow Co., GA, Obituary

The Daily Tribune News, (Cartersville, GA) - October 28, 2019

Mary Audrey Towe, 73, of Adairsville passed away October 26, 2019, at home with her family. She was born in Adairsville, GA, on October 21, 1946, to the late James Roy and Ethel Baggett Towe.

Audrey was retired from Klopman Mills/Galey & Lord where she worked faithfully for 35+ years. She was a lifelong member of Dry Creek Baptist Church in Adairsville.

Audrey loved her family and was a devoted sister to Sara Towe Blankenship, her husband Gene Blankenship, the late James Daniel and JoAnn Towe and Vivian Towe Armstrong. She was most beloved by her nephews and nieces whom she loved as her children, Jeff Blankenship, Mark and Jennifer Armstrong Elliott, Andy and Tonya Blankenship and Casey and Melanie Armstrong Twilley. Great-nieces and nephews, Ashley Cole Griffin, Jake Elliott, Cam Blankenship, Hannah Blankenship, Grace Twilley, and Mason Twilley.

Funeral services will be held Wednesday, October 30, 2019, at 2:00 pm from Dry Creek Baptist Church, Adairsville with Reverends Randy Jackson and Larry Towe officiating. Interment will follow in Eastview Cemetery, Adairsville. Pallbearers include Jeff Blankenship, Andy Blankenship, Jake Elliott, Mason Twilley, Cam Blankenship, and Carl Towe. Honorary pallbearers include, Randy Hazelwood and Bobby Hazelwood. Barton Funeral Home, Adairsville.

2019, Cartersville, Bartow Co., GA, Obituary

The Daily Tribune News, (Cartersville, GA) - April 2, 2019

William Benjamin "Ben" Hager of Cartersville passed away at his home on March 28, 2019, Ben began his life's adventure on July 17, 1982 in West Virginia. Ben was 36 years young.

His family moved to Cartersville in December of 1984 and this is where Ben grew up, went to school, made lifelong friends, worked hard and played hard, and lived the rest of his adventure. He loved the outdoors, being on the water and on his four-wheeler. He had 2 faithful pups, Zeke and Lucy, and loved them dearly.

Ben graduated from Cass High School and went to work with his dad in the landscaping business. He then pursued work with his learned skills in welding at Sheet Metal Components. This eventually led him to a 10 year career with Paragon Trailer Center where he began as a Tank Trailer Mechanic/Welder and worked his way up to Parts and Sales Manager. Restructuring late last year at Paragon then led Ben to a new career in the tanker industry as a Business Development Manager with National Tank Service beginning January 2, 2019.

In the spring of 2016, Ben met Ashley and her two children, Adison and Graham. The two were engaged on September 2, 2017. Together with their families, they eagerly awaited to celebrate their nuptials on March 30, 2019.

Ben was preceded in death by his grandparents, William Bill and Janet Barker Hager, and Donald Dewain Toler; and his cousin, William "Billy" Moscoe Conley.

Ben was an only child and survived by his fianc√© and her children, Ashley Crosby, Adison Crosby and Graham Crosby of Morganton; his father, William Carlos Hager (Teresa) of Rockmart, his mother, Cynthia Toler Dutton (Troy) of Adairsville; his grandmother, Helen Blankenship of Adairsville; his step-brothers, Eric Crumley (Whitney) and Matt Crumley of Rockmart; his step-sister, Amanda Dutton Samples (Sean) of Fairmount, and Maggie Dutton Taylor (Trey) of Savannah; and several aunts, uncles, and cousins.

Funeral services will be conducted at 2:00 pm, on Thursday, April 4, 2014, in the chapel of Parnick Jennings Funeral Home, with Pastor Lane Vrooman officiating. A private interment will follow.

2019, Cartersville, Bartow Co., GA, Obituary

The Daily Tribune News, (Cartersville, GA) - July 20, 2019

Larry David Craig, 51, of Cartersville, GA, passed away Friday, July 19, 2019. Larry was born March 11, 1968, to Mr. Lawrence George Craig and Mrs. Viola Millwood Johnsey in Marietta, GA.

Larry was a very talented man. In his high school years, Cassville High School Class of '86, he was in marching band, Eagle Scout, and a straight A student. Larry was truly dedicated to anything he pursued. He was a devoted husband, son, father, brother and grandfather. In Larry's later years, he enjoyed being PePaw to his three grandchildren. He worked for Chemical Products for 12 years before working for AT&T for over 19 years. Larry will be truly missed by all who knew and loved him.

He is preceded in death by his grandparents, Mr. Virgil and Mary Lou Craig and Mr. Jim Millwood and Lois Millwood Lipscomb; mother-in-law, Linda Ruth Berry; aunt, Shirley Ann Hall; and nephew, Maverick Wehunt.

He is survived by his loving wife, Michelle Berry Craig; children Kirsten (Armando) Craig, Aire Craig, Brandyn and Parker Jeffery; mother, Viola (Daryl) Johnsey; father, Lawrence (Cathy) George Craig; grandchildren Ellery, Sawyer and Finn; brother, Allen Hitt; sisters Jenny (Simon) Drummond, Michelle (Brian) Blankenship and Connie (Jason) Arp. Several nieces and nephews also survive to cherish Larry's memory.

A Celebration of Life Service for Larry will be conducted in the Owen Funeral Home Chapel Monday, July 22, 2019, at eleven o'clock in the morning. Serving as pallbearers will be: Brandyn Jeffery, Parker Jeffery, Caleb Wehunt, Allen Hitt, Armando Ramirez Saucedo and Drew Hightower. Interment will follow the service at Pine Haven Memorial Gardens in Hollywood, Al.

The Daily Tribune News, (Cartersville, GA) - November 25, 2019

Anthony Steven Dorsett, 28, passed away on Saturday, November 23, 2019. Born in Rome on December 11, 1990, he was the son of Max Dorsett and Kelly McIntyre.

Anthony loved everybody especially his family. He was employed as a heavy equipment operator and was a member of local 926. He was close to completing his apprenticeship. Anthony loved working on cars and racing Go Karts. He was a Go Kart Racing Champion and the mechanic behind his consecutive championship racing seasons.

He was preceded in death by his grandparents, Maxie L. Dorsett and Jimmy Lee McIntyre.

Survivors include his parents; his brother and sister-in-law, David and Mara Dorsett; his nieces, Madison Dorsett and Natalie Dorsett; his grandparents, June and Wayne Isaac, and Peggy Blankenship; and numerous aunts, uncles, and cousins.

Funeral services will be held at 2:00 pm, on Friday, November 29, 2019, in the chapel of Parnick Jennings Funeral Home and Cremation Services with Reverend Don Jenkins, Pam Dorsett, and Mickeal Lloyd officiating. Burial will follow on Kingston Cemetery. Serving as pallbearers will be Greg Turner, Brian Isaac, Bryan Moore, Zach Pas, Junior Moore, and Eric Moore.

+2019, Kingston, Bartow Co., GA, Obituary

The Daily Tribune News, (Cartersville, GA) - October 4, 2019

Mr. John Wesley Baker, age 84, of Kingston, GA, passed away Thursday evening, October 3, 2019, at Floyd Medical Center, Rome, [Floyd Co., GA]. He was born in Bartow County, July 7, 1935, son of the late John Akin Baker and Amanda Cochran Baker.

He was of the Baptist faith and attended Amazing Grace Baptist Church. He worked as a machinist at EZ Mills for 38 years before retiring. An avid musician, he enjoyed singing and playing bluegrass music with several different groups. In his younger years he raced dirt tracks and later became a member of the Georgia Automobile Racing Hall of Fame in Dawsonville.

Mr. Baker was preceded in death by his parents; wife, Mary Elizabeth Hale Baker in 2014; son, Johnny Baker in 1998; and sisters, Barbara (Bill) Blankenship and Jamie (Sam) Simmons.

Survivors include his son and daughter-in-law, Marty and DeAndra Baker of Cartersville; daughter and son-in-law, Sarah (Sissy) and Don Jenkins of Kingston; daughter-in-law, Misty Jackson Baker of Adairsville; grandchildren, Kristi (John) Culver, Holly (Alex) Coker, Mitchell Jenkins, Aliza Baker, and Bryce Baker; great-grandchildren, Cooper, Owen, and Weston Culver, Pepper Culver, Cade Baker, and Hudson Coker.

Funeral services will be held Monday, October 7, 2019, at 11:00 am from the chapel of Barton Funeral Home, Adairsville, with Reverends David Baker and Tim Bennett officiating. Interment will follow in the family lot of Kingston Cemetery. Pallbearers will be Sammy Simmons, Jason Alexander, Jeff Williams, James Curtis, Alex Coker, and Michael Herod. Honorary pallbearers will be Doyle Watters, Wayne Jacobs, and Randy Bennett.

+2017, Fitzgerald, Ben Hill Co., GA, Obituary

https://www.afterlife.co/us/obituary-fitzgerald-harold-eugene-blankenship-6471847

Harold Eugene Blankenship, 83, of Fitzgerald, Georgia, died Saturday, November 25, 2017, at his residence. He was born July 8, 1934, in Davin, West Virginia, to the late Gona & Ruth Cline Blankenship.

He served his country honorably in the United States Army. He was stationed in Germany between the Korean and Vietnam Wars. Mr. Blankenship worked for General Motors as a tool and die man at Delco-Remy in Fitzgerald as well as in Parma, Ohio. He returned to Fitzgerald a year ago from Franklin, West Virginia. He was an avid hunter and fisherman and loved to watch old Westerns.

He is survived by his wife of 61 years, Marie Burgess Blankenship of Fitzgerald; his children and their spouses: Harold Lynn Blankenship & Roxanne of McMinnville, Oregon, Don Blankenship of Lake Milton, Ohio, David Blankenship & Tracey of Plattsburgh, New York, Larry Blankenship & Jeanette of Durham, North Carolina, and Lori Blankenship McDonald & Jason of Fitzgerald; 12 grandchildren; 2 step-grandchildren; 2 great-grandchildren; two sisters: Eva Mae Reese of Hollywood, Florida and Charlotte Crews of Cleveland, Ohio; and a brother, Ronnie Blankenship & Connie of Surprise, Arizona.

Private memorial services will be held at a later date.

He was a veteran in the United States Air Force and was a member of Morningside Baptist Church. He was also a member of the Macon Amateur Radio Club (call #WU4C), raised poultry for Strain Poultry and was retired from GA Kraft.

He was predeceased by his wife Vivian Joyce Skipper; and parents Oscar Ross and Maggie Yearty Kitchens. He was also predeceased by seven of his eight siblings, Susie Riggins, John Kitchens, O.R. Kitchens, Nolan Kitchens, Eva Blankenship, Bertha Epps, Elizabeth Woodward and Luther Kitchens.

Survivors include daughters, Luann McCook (Marcus) of Jones County and Barbara Davis (Dwaine) of Jones County; grandchildren, Dana Tice (Chris) of Jones County and Brandi Alkire (Mason) of Locus Grove; great grandchildren, Makenzie Lewis (Austin) of Norfolk, Virginia and Paige of Jones County, Savannah, Jessica and Josh; and sister-in-law Nell Milam of Macon, GA.

Funeral services will be held on Tuesday, April 5, 2016 at 2:00 PM at Morningside Baptist, 3519 Jeffersonville Rd, Macon, GA 31217. Reverend Ron Watson and Dr. Bill Hardee will be officiating with burial at Henderson Stripling Cemetery on Henderson Rd.

Published in The Telegraph on Apr. 20, 2017

Matthew David Blankenship - September 27, 1993 - April 18, 2017 - Macon, GA.

Matthew, 23, went to be with his Lord and Savior on Tuesday, April 18, 2017. He was born in Abilene, TX to Michael Blankenship and Mystee Leno Wilcox.

Matthew was a 2012 graduate of Rutland High School. While at Rutland Matthew was selected to participate in the Governor's Honors Program in Voice. Matthew attended Georgia Southern University where he was involved in the Sing at Southern group and the Georgia Southern Chorale. As a member of the Southern Chorale Matthew toured Austria and Italy and sang at St. Peter's Basilica in Vatican City. Matthew also sang in several operas and theater productions.

He was preceded in death by his sister, Melodee Blankenship.

Matthew is survived by father, Michael (Emily) Blankenship of Macon, mother, Mystee (Dean) Wilcox of Gray, paternal grandparents, Charles (Ginny) Blankenship and Sharon (L.E.) McElmurray, maternal grandfather, William Leno, several aunts, uncles, nieces, nephews, and cousins.

A Celebration of his life will be held on Saturday, April 22, 2017 at 11:00 a.m. at Bellevue Baptist Church with the Rev. Jason Blankenship and the Rev. George McMillan officiating. The family will greet friends from 10:00 a.m. to service time.

2018, Macon, Bibb Co., GA, Obituary

The Macon Telegraph, (GA) - January 14, 2018

Jack E. Harrison September 23, 1937 - January 13, 2018 Macon, GA-

Jack E. Harrison, 80, passed away on Saturday, January 13, 2018 surrounded by his family. He was born in Crawford, County to the late Richard and Mattie Harrison.

Upon graduation from Crawford County High School in 1955, he and three of his friends joined the Navy to see the World. In 1992 after 34 years of employment, he retired from Robins Air Force Base as Chief of the Resources Management Branch, Directorate of Distribution. During his career Jack hired hundreds of employees for their first job on base. He was a member and Past President of the Exchange Club Macon West. He was a member of Lizella Methodist Church, New Beginnings Sunday School, and the Men's Club. Jack enjoyed sports on TV and was an avid crappie fisherman and bird hunter. He especially enjoyed quail hunting with his bird dogs. He was a dedicated NASCAR race fan since the early 1960's. Jack had a mischievous sense of humor and enjoyed pulling pranks and jokes on his friends.

Jack was preceded in death by his brothers, Cook Harrison, John Harrison and sister, Louise Woolf.

He is survived by his longtime companion and wife of 53 years, Annette Harrison of Macon, niece, Brenda (Gary) Matheny of Cleveland, TN, niece, Connie (Roger) Alverson of Thomaston, GA and Cathy (Andy) Pollard of Thomaston, nephew, Ronnie (Mary) Harrison of Waycross, great nieces, Tiffany (Jason) Blankenship, Harleigh Alverson and Krysten Alverson and great nephews, Brian (Pauline) Matheny, USAF and Wyatt Pollard and 10 great-great nieces and nephews. He is also survived by his adopted grandson and buddy, Seth Ivey of Lizella. Jack especially enjoyed the time he spent with Seth watching him grow up from a three month old baby to become a good fisherman, dirt bike rider, and football player.

A Celebration of his Life will be held on Tuesday, January 16, 2018 at 2:00 p.m. in the Chapel of Macon Memorial Park Funeral Home. Burial will be in Macon Memorial Park Cemetery with the Rev. Jason Blankenship and Rev. Gosh Gale officiating.

+2019, Macon, Bibb Co., GA, Obituary

The Macon Telegraph, (GA) - November 22, 2019

Jimmie Lloyd "Jim" McGreggor, 86, of Macon, Georgia, died Saturday, November 16, 2019, after a sudden illness. Jim was born on Oct. 29, 1933, in Columbiana, Alabama.

He soon moved to a farm in rural Bibb County, Georgia, where he enjoyed the simple life with his mother and father and his 11 brothers and sisters. He attended Redding Elementary School, Lanier High School, and the University of Georgia, where he was a member of Sigma Chi fraternity. Jim married the love of his life, Lanette Adams, in 1959. His wife of 48 years, Lanette died in 2007, and Jim wore his wedding ring until the day he died. Jim enjoyed bluegrass music, southern food and golf, but his family and his faith were the most important parts of his life. Jim loved his two sons, their spouses, and his two grandsons and two granddaughters. He enjoyed spending time with his brothers and sisters, and his large and ever-growing family of nieces, nephews, and grand-nieces and -nephews.

Jim served as the chairman of the board of deacons at Tattnall Square Baptist Church during the late 60's and 70's and was instrumental in moving the church to its present location on Zebulon Road, where he sang in the choir. He was an organizer and a founding board member of Tattnall Square Academy. Later in life, Jim moved his church home to Lizella Baptist Church, where for many years he taught Sunday School with his beloved wife. In 2007, Jim retired from Ferguson Enterprises after 50 years of service.

Jim was preceded in death by his wife, Lanette Adams McGreggor; his parents, Henry Leonard McGreggor and Sallie Royal McGreggor; his daughter-in-law Michele Clark McGreggor; his brothers and sisters Dorothy Christine Knight, William Howard McGreggor, Henry Leonard McGreggor Jr., Hollie Pearl Davis, Jack Carlton McGreggor, Eddie Ray McGreggor, and Wilma Carlene Taylor; his half brother Delmar Leroy Blankenship Jr.; and his half sister Annie Louise Mote.

He is survived by his sons Brian Keith McGreggor of Roswell, Georgia, and Kendall Brent McGreggor of Newnan, Georgia; his daughter-in-law Jennifer Macklin McGreggor; his grandchildren Andrew Clark McGreggor, George Macklin McGreggor, Mary Katherine McGreggor, and Sarah Grace McGreggor; his sister Mary Frances Williams; his brother Benjamin Louis McGreggor; and their families.

A private family graveside service will be held at 2 pm, on Sunday, November 24, 2019, in Macon Memorial Park Cemetery.

+2017, Hoboken, Brantley Co., GA, Obituary

Waycross Journal-Herald (GA) (Published as Waycross Journal Herald (GA)) - October 4, 2017

Clifford Thomas Justice, 84, of Hoboken, died Monday morning (Oct. 2, 2017) at Memorial Satilla Health in Waycross [Ware Co., GA] following an extended illness. He was a native of Broxton, born Jan. 10, 1933 to the late Jack Justice and Alma Cato Justice.

He served his country with the United States Army during the Korean War and retired as salesman with Hoboken Building Supply on Jan. 10, 1998, after many years of service. Lillie Mozelle Blankenship went home to be with our wonderful Lord and Savior on Tuesday, February 17, 2015, with her loving family at her side. While she passed due to an extended illness, she relied on the Lord to comfort her until it was her time to be called home. She was born December 6, 1925, in Suwannee, Georgia, to Charles and Lillie Belle Stonecypher, the second youngest of eight children.

She moved to Rochelle with her family as a child and lived there until she married the true love of her life, Carroll. She was active in World War II, being one of the original "Rosie-the-Riveters." They moved to Statesboro in 1958, where they purchased and operated a successful restaurant.

Mrs. Blankenship was a longtime member of First Baptist Church and the Camilla Boyd Sunday School Class. She enjoyed gardening, being with her family and helping others. She believed in staying busy at all times, if not doing for herself then busy helping someone else who was in need. While her life included many chapters, being wife, mother and grandmother, she found completeness in being GiGi.

Loved ones left to remember her are a beloved daughter and son-in-law, Reneau and David Tompkins of Statesboro; her loving son and daughter-in-law, David and Paulette Blankenship of Eastman, Ga. She also leaves behind four grandchildren and their spouses, Farris and Diana Tompkins of Statesboro, Luci and Chris Harvey of Brooklet, Amanda and Cody Payne of Dublin and Abbi and Clay Barker of Suwannee; and step-grandchildren, Josh McCrannie and Leslie Wilkinson of Eastman.

Although her children and grandchildren brought much joy to her life, her great-grandchildren were the lights in her life, Emerson and Olivia Tompkins, Sierra, EmmaLeigh and AnnaBelle Harvey and Noah Payne. She also leaves behind a host of nieces, nephews and friends.

She was preceded in death by her husband, Lewis Carroll Blankenship; all of her brothers and sisters and many other relatives and friends whom she loved dearly.

The funeral service will be held at noon on Thursday, February 19th, in the chapel of Hodges-Moore Funeral Home with Dr. John Waters officiating. Interment will follow in Bulloch Memorial Gardens. Pallbearers will be nephews. Her Sunday school class will serve as honorary pallbearers.

+2017, Statesboro, Bulloch Co., GA, Obituary

Statesboro Herald, January 10, 2017

David William Tompkins: The loving hand of God came down Saturday morning [07Jan2017] and took David home to heaven at the age of 67. He lived his life and raised his family with his loving wife, Reneau, by his side in Statesboro. Born May 22, 1949, in Electra, Texas, his parents, the Reverend Warren and Bessie Tompkins, raised him to have a sincere love for the Lord.

On the day of his birth, there was a terrible storm raging. His mother was ushered to the hospital's basement and as the tornado alarms sounded, David entered this world. At the early age of two weeks, his mother and daddy took him fishing and this joy continued throughout his entire life. He spent many wonderful hours on the Ogeechee River and the Savannah River, spending good times with family and friends. He loved the world God created, appreciating all that the Lord had given him, and spent his life letting God's light shine through him.

In March of 1958, the Reverend W. F. Tompkins was called to Bible Baptist Church in Statesboro, where he served as pastor for 36 years. David grew up knowing and serving the Lord from a very young age. At the age of 15, he started leading the choir and congregation in singing and this continued throughout his life, ending at Temple Baptist Church, where he served in many capacities, including being a deacon. David's strong faith continued even in his long illness.

In the same month and year that the Tompkins family moved to Statesboro, Reneau's family moved to Statesboro as well. Their lives touched many times over the years, but in high school, they really got to know one another and eventually fell in love. They married the year after graduation on January 10, 1971, because they just could not wait to start their life together. They celebrated everything and through David's success at Liberty National Insurance Company, they enjoyed many trips and awards.

Together they raised three children, Farris, who married Diana Currin; Luci, who married Chris Harvey of Hiawassee; and Abbi, who married Clay Barker of Suwanee. They were blessed with five grandchildren, Emerson and Olivia Tompkins and Emmaleigh, Annabelle and Sierra Harvey.

In addition to his immediate family, David is survived by his brother-in-law and sister-in-law, David and Paulette Blankenship of Eastman; niece, Amanda Payne of Dublin; aunt, Mrs. Nell Hall of Green Cove Springs, Fla.; and many nieces, nephews and cousins.

David was preceded in death by his parents, two sisters and his father-in-law and mother-in-law, Carroll and Mozelle Blankenship.

The funeral service will be held 11 a.m. Wednesday, January 11, 2017, at Temple Baptist Church with the Reverend Jim Creel officiating. Burial will follow in Bulloch Memorial Gardens. Pallbearers will be Edward Thompson, Jack "Buddy" Brinson, Harvey Brannen, Randy Canady, James Harris and Keith Carr. Honorary pallbearers will be members of the Marvin Pittman Class of 1967.

The Atlanta Journal-Constitution, (GA) - December 27, 2015

Emily Doris Hendrix Goddard, beloved wife of the late Robert Carl Goddard, Jr., and daughter of the late Charles James and Era Blankenship Hendrix, passed away quietly on December 23, 2015 in Atlanta, Georgia. The youngest of five children, Doris was born in Atlanta on November 5, 1930.

Soon after her birth, the family moved to Woodstock, Georgia in Cherokee County where they owned a small dairy farm. Doris enjoyed working alongside her father, and her interest and love for animals began to flourish. In 1947, Doris married Robert Carl Goddard, Jr., a returning WWII Army veteran and son of another old Cherokee County family. They were married for 42 years and were the proud parents of two daughters and one son.

Doris was known for her love of family, her sharp wit, lively sense of humor and great love for all God's creatures. She delighted in gently nursing wounded wildlife back to health. While maintaining a private and humble lifestyle, she fully captured the image of a strong, southern lady. Although her favorite spot on earth was the home where she and Robert raised their children, she delighted in visiting her beloved North Georgia Mountains and was proud to tell of her once-in-a-lifetime family trip to Europe. Doris will be deeply missed by her family and friends.

Doris is survived by her three children, Gayle Goddard Anderson, Carole Goddard Haley (Frank), Robert Carl Goddard, III (Kathi); six grandchildren: Michael Buford Anderson, Nathaniel Goddard Anderson (Sandi); Meg Haley Gerard (Jim), Fran Haley Baldwin (Billy), Lori Haley Thompson (Scott), David Haley (Laura); and nine great-grandchildren: Meredith Anderson; Will, Sydney and Kathryn Anderson; Madeline, Olivia and Sophia Gerard; Sarah Kate and Haley Baldwin.

The funeral service will be at 11:00 a.m. on Monday, December 28th at Little River Methodist Church, 12455 Highway 92, Woodstock, Georgia 30188. Officiating ministers are Dr. Gil Watson of Northside Methodist Atlanta and Rev. Bill Coady of Little River Methodist Woodstock.

Ray loved to fish, and loved woodworking. He played a big role as one of Santa's big helpers for the children at Christmastime. He was a connoisseur of movies and had a joyful soul. He loved to make people laugh.

In addition to his father, he was preceded in death by a brother, Kenny Woodall.

Survivors include his son, Allen Woodall and his wife Jo Ellen of Villa Rica; his mother, Doris Earnhart of Hiawassee; sisters, Cindy Stewart, also of Hiawassee, Dana Morgan of Cartersville, and Connie Woodall of Franklin; brothers, Kenny Shiver of Hiawassee, Daryl Blankinship of Cartersville, and Sherman Woodall of Franklin; a granddaughter, Emaleigh Satterfield; and several nieces and nephews.

A memorial service will be held on Saturday, March 9, 2019, at 2:00 pm, in the Chapel of Parnick Jennings Funeral Home with The Reverend Scott Johnson officiating. Inurnment will be at a later date at Georgia National Cemetery in Canton.

The Atlanta Journal-Constitution, (GA) Date: August 23, 2015

Robert Winchester Irving, 80, of Marietta, GA, passed away on August 17, 2015. He was born in Washington, DC., a graduate of Phillips Exeter Academy and Princeton University. Bob served as First Lieutenant in the U.S. Marine Corps. He pursued a professional career in Insurance and Banking at Maryland National Bank and Equitable Trust Company in Baltimore and retired from Barnett Bank as an Executive V.P. and Senior Credit Policy Officer in Florida. Additionally, he was President of the Neighborhood Housing Service, Inc. in Baltimore, President of the Maryland Mortgage Bankers Association and Chairman of the American Bankers Association. Upon retirement, he provided his business and finance acumen to a multitude of non-profit organizations in Florida and Georgia.

Bob is survived by his wife, Mary, and his daughter, Susan Irving Taylor with her husband Terence of Georgetown, ME, and his son, Robert Benson Irving with his wife, Mary Catherine of Baltimore, MD; five grandchildren, Rebecca and Rachel Taylor, Stephen, Christopher and Elizabeth Irving; and sisters, Katherine Krier, ID and Nancy Irving, WA. Blending Bob & Mary's families includes children, Bud Ratliff with his wife, Fran of Midway, KY; Julie Kingsley of Woodstock, GA and Lindsay Curtis Blankenship with her husband, Bill of Marietta, GA; 10 grandchildren and one great grandchild.

A memorial service will be held at Mt. Zion United Methodist Church at 1770 Johnson Ferry Road in Marietta, GA, on August 29, 2015 at 12:30 pm. The family will hold a private graveside service.

William Belisario, Sr. (Bill) of Marietta, Ga. went to be with his Lord & on Monday, November 23 at 1:18AM. He was, born in Ray City, Ga, in 1935

Bill had a great love for his family and is survived by his wife Julia Stinchcomb Belisario, and children Michele Hilton of Cartersville, Ga., Helene Belisario Blankenship and son-in law Steve Blankenship of Acworth, Ga., Samantha Belisario of Cartersville,Ga, Kathy Hall of Cartersville, Ga, William Robert Belisario, Jr (Robert) of Cartersville, Ga., Suzie Stinson and son-in-law John Stinson of Gulf Breeze, Fl., Charlotte Wolf of Metairie Louisiana, Ga., Danielle Belisario Biddle and son-in-law Lloyd Biddle of Kennesaw, Ga, Stewart Belisario and Andrea Belisario of Cartersville, step son Mike Cochran of Austell, Ga, and Lynn Cochran of Marietta, Ga. He is also survived by his grandchildren, Britney Burton, Beth Keener Dent, Jackie Hovarth, Jensen Hovarth, Austin Hovarth, 'Aine Andersen, Jessica Burger, Bailey Belisario, Blane Belisario, Preston Biddle, Cameron Biddle, Anna Biddle, Christopher Cochran, Austin Cochran, and many great grandchildren. He is also survived by his brother-in-law Jack Clagett of Marietta, and nephews Kevin Clagett, Scott Clagett, and Mike Clagett, and life long extended family, Jimmy Bird, Ronnie Bird, and Diane Rouse.

He is predeceased by his sister Carole Clagett, brother Lanny Belisario and 2 grandsons, Eugene Hilton, and Christopher Burger.

Bill Belisario, a long time resident of Cobb County and grew up in South Miami, graduating from Coral Gables High School. After graduation he began employment with Southern Bell in Florida, and transferred to Atlanta in 1968. He has resided in Cobb County since that time. Retiring from AT&T in 1985 he established Bel Star Systems which later became Best Star Systems in Marietta, Ga, as the owner/operator for over 30 years.

As a devoted Christian, Bill was an active member of Mt. View Church in Marietta for 28 years. His greatest passion was service, and was found time to help many people in his life long journey. He loved to travel country roads, fishing, and being with family. As an avid gardener, he enjoyed spending as much time as possible in his gardens, along with his children and grandchildren. Bill touched many lives and will be missed by many.

Published in The Atlanta Journal-Constitution from Dec. 26 to Dec. 27, 2016

Charles (Charlie) Albert Parsons passed away December 22, 2016. He was born to Louise Sommer and Charles Parsons on April 10, 1945.

The Parsons family moved to Miami where he graduated from Coral Gables High School in '63. Later, he graduated with an Industrial Management degree from Georgia Tech in '68. After working for Control Data in Austin, TX, he returned to Georgia Tech for a master's degree in Information and Computer Science and graduated in '72. He spent the next 25 years with IBM in Raleigh and Atlanta, then on to JD Edwards followed by becoming and independent consultant.

Charlie is survived by his wife of 47 years, Rosalyn Parsons, and was a longtime member of Mt. Bethel UMC; children, Brandon and Kimberly Parsons; sister, Ann (Jim) Moore; sister, Ellen (David) Hartley; nieces and nephews, Brad (Amy) Moore, Cindy (Bjorn) Nelson, Jennifer (Shane) Blankenship and Lindsay (Brett) Ritenour; Sister-in-law, Joyce (Robert) Starr, Bob and John (Catherine) Starr.

Memorial service will be held at Mt. Bethel UMC in Marietta, GA, Wednesday, December 28, 2016 at 11:00 am.

He was an Eagle Scout and remained close with his scouting friends. In lieu of flowers, donations should be sent to Mt. Bethel UMC Boy Scout Troup 1011, located at 4385 Lower Roswell Road, Marietta, GA 30068.

Karen Burns Blakey "Bama" to her grandchildren" passed away February 1, 2017. She was born in Charleston, WV, on July 10, 1948 to Annabel and L. L. Burns.

She was educated at Chatham Hall and Hollins college both located in VA. She moved to Atlanta in 1970 where she met her husband of 45 years, Paul Blakey. Together they raised two daughters, Ryan and Beth. Karen started working at Northside Reality in 1983 and continued her career as a sales associate for over 30 years.

Karen enjoyed many outdoor activities. She was active in ALTA for many years, enjoyed hiking, gardening and loved football, especially WVU. She was a member of St. Catherine's Episcopal Church and was involved in many charitable programs.

She is survived by her husband, Paul Blakey, daughters Ryan Blankenship and husband Danny of Atlanta, GA, Elizabeth Blakey Gato and husband Isaiah Gato of Charleston, SC, granddaughter Avery Blankenship, grandsons Andrew Laiz, Jonah Gato and Asher Gato, sister Emily Legg of Lewisburg, WV, many cousins and friends.

At her request there will be no service locally. A family graveside service and memorial will be held at a later date in Lewisburg, WV.

In lieu of flowers, family asks that memorial donations be made to Autism Speaks or the charity of your choice. Karen was a gift to all who knew her and she will be sorely missed. To leave an online condolence for the family, please visit http://www.hmpattersoncantonhill.com/
